Docs.summary: Information you can retrieve about a particular application.

remarks.para: Information you can retrieve about a particular application. This corresponds to information collected from the AndroidManifest.xml's <application> tag.

Docs.param: A containing a Java Native Interface (JNI) object reference.
Docs.summary: A constructor used when creating managed representations of JNI objects; called by the runtime.

remarks.para: This constructor is invoked by the runtime infrastructure () to create a new managed representation for a Java Native Interface object.
The constructor will initializes the property of the new instance using and .

Docs.summary: Class implementing the Application's backup functionality.

remarks.para: Class implementing the Application's backup functionality. From the "backupAgent" attribute. This is an optional attribute and will be null if the application does not specify it in its manifest.
If android:allowBackup is set to false, this attribute is ignored.

Docs.summary: Class implementing the Application object.

remarks.para: Class implementing the Application object. From the "class" attribute.

Docs.summary: The maximum smallest screen width the application is designed for.

remarks.para: The maximum smallest screen width the application is designed for. If 0, nothing has been specified. Comes from attribute of the <supports-screens> tag.

Docs.summary: Full path to a directory assigned to the package for its persistent data.

remarks.para: Full path to a directory assigned to the package for its persistent data.

Docs.summary: Describe the kinds of special objects contained in this Parcelable's marshalled representation.

remarks.para: Describe the kinds of special objects contained in this Parcelable's marshalled representation.

Docs.summary: A style resource identifier (in the package's resources) of the description of an application.

remarks.para: A style resource identifier (in the package's resources) of the description of an application. From the "description" attribute or, if not set, 0.

Docs.summary: When false, indicates that all components within this application are considered disabled, regardless of their individually set enabled status.

remarks.para: When false, indicates that all components within this application are considered disabled, regardless of their individually set enabled status.

Docs.summary: The maximum smallest screen width the application will work on.

remarks.para: The maximum smallest screen width the application will work on. If 0, nothing has been specified. Comes from attribute of the <supports-screens> tag.

Docs.param: A PackageManager from which the label can be loaded; usually the PackageManager from which you originally retrieved this item.
Docs.summary: Retrieve the textual description of the application.

remarks.para: Retrieve the textual description of the application. This will call back on the given PackageManager to load the description from the application.

Docs.summary: Class implementing the Application's manage space functionality.

remarks.para: Class implementing the Application's manage space functionality. From the "manageSpaceActivity" attribute. This is an optional attribute and will be null if applications don't specify it in their manifest

Docs.summary: Full path to the directory where native JNI libraries are stored.

remarks.para: Full path to the directory where native JNI libraries are stored.

Docs.summary: Optional name of a permission required to be able to access this application's components.

remarks.para: Optional name of a permission required to be able to access this application's components. From the "permission" attribute.

Docs.summary: The name of the process this application should run in.

remarks.para: The name of the process this application should run in. From the "process" attribute or, if not set, the same as packageName.

Docs.summary: Full path to the publicly available parts of , including resources and manifest.

remarks.para: Full path to the publicly available parts of , including resources and manifest. This may be different from if an application is forward locked.

Docs.summary: The required smallest screen width the application can run on.

remarks.para: The required smallest screen width the application can run on. If 0, nothing has been specified. Comes from attribute of the <supports-screens> tag.

Docs.summary: Paths to all shared libraries this application is linked against.

remarks.para: Paths to all shared libraries this application is linked against. This field is only set if the flag was used when retrieving the structure.

Docs.summary: Full path to the base APK for this application.

remarks.para: Full path to the base APK for this application.

Docs.summary: Full path to the publicly available parts of , including resources and manifest.

remarks.para: Full path to the publicly available parts of , including resources and manifest. This may be different from if an application is forward locked.

Docs.summary: Full paths to zero or more split APKs that, when combined with the base APK defined in , form a complete application.

remarks.para: Full paths to zero or more split APKs that, when combined with the base APK defined in , form a complete application.

Docs.summary: The minimum SDK version this application targets.

remarks.para: The minimum SDK version this application targets. It may run on earlier versions, but it knows how to work with any new behavior added at this version. Will be if this is a development build and the app is targeting that. You should compare that this number is >= the SDK version number at which your behavior was introduced.

Docs.summary: Default task affinity of all activities in this application.

remarks.para: Default task affinity of all activities in this application. See for more information. This comes from the "taskAffinity" attribute.

Docs.summary: A style resource identifier (in the package's resources) of the default visual theme of the application.

remarks.para: A style resource identifier (in the package's resources) of the default visual theme of the application. From the "theme" attribute or, if not set, 0.

Docs.summary: This API supports the Mono for Android infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.
Docs.value: A which contains the java.lang.Class JNI value corresponding to this type.

remarks.para: This property is used to control which jclass is provided to methods like .

Docs.summary: This API supports the Mono for Android infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.
Docs.value: A which provides the declaring type.

remarks.para: This property is used to control virtual vs. non virtual method dispatch against the underlying JNI object. When this property is equal to the declaring type, then virtual method invocation against the JNI object is performed; otherwise, we assume that the method was overridden by a derived type, and perform non-virtual methdo invocation.

Docs.summary: The default extra UI options for activities in this application.

remarks.para: The default extra UI options for activities in this application. Set from the attribute in the activity's manifest.
